meanings.sent1: The diprotic molecule easily loses two hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent2: This solution contains a diprotic acid that can donate two hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent3: The diprotic compound seemed to wave goodbye to its hydrogen atoms.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as diprotic as the acid, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The diprotic nature of the substance made it react strongly with the other chemicals.

meanings.definition: Capable of donating two protons in an acid-base reaction.
meanings.sent1: The diprotic acid swiftly donates two protons in the reaction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the diprotic solution to understand its proton donation ability.
meanings.sent3: The diprotic liquid was in a generous mood, offering two protons to the base.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was diprotic, always ready to donate more than expected.
meanings.sent5: The diprotic behavior of the acid amazed the researchers with its double proton donation.
